header.subtitle: Consistently rated as excellent by 245-65r17 drivers
Most popular among drivers in PA
Check out the sale price on this tire
Consistently rated as excellent by 245-65r17 drivers

content.body:
### Shop 245/65R17 Tire Size What kinds of vehicles use 245/65R17 tires? Well, you can count the Ford Explorer, Hyundai Veracruz, Chevrolet Trailblazer, Jeep Grand Cherokee and Toyota Highlander in that number. The common denominator here, of course, is that they’re all trucks, SUVs and crossovers (and mainly older models). For most drivers who are just using their SUVs for daily-driver duties like commuting, errands and an occasional road trip, all season tires are the best call. All-season tires offer solid grip even in light snow as well as a comfortable ride, low road noise, predictable handling and overall good road manners. If you’re looking for a premium set of all-season tires to replace 245/65R17 OEM tires on your SUV, some of our suggestions would include the Westlake SU318, Michelin Premier LTX, Bridgestone Dueler H/L 422 Ecopia, [Pirelli Scorpion All Season Plus 3](https://simpletire.com/brands/pirelli-tires/scorpion-all-season-plus-3), Continental TerrainContact H/T, Yokohama Geolandar CV G058, or Kumho Crugen HT51. Popular vehicles: 2002-2005 Lincoln Aviator
2002-2015 Ford Explorer
2006-2015 Hyundai Veracruz
2001-2019 Chevrolet Trailblazer
1997-2010 Jeep Grand Cherokee
2008-2013 Toyota Highlander Maybe you like to take your SUV off the highway for some adventures now and then. All-terrain tires offer great traction in mud, rocks and loose dirt, without sacrificing too much in terms of ride quality and civilized behavior on the pavement. Check out all-terrain tires like the Toyo Open Country A/T III, BFGoodrich All-Terrain T/A KO2, Falken Wildpeak A/T3W, or [Kumho Road Venture AT51](https://simpletire.com/brands/kumho-tires/road-venture-at51) for your SUV. For areas where harsh winter weather can leave deep snow on the ground for weeks at a time, we’d recommend winter tires. Modern winter tires offer excellent grip in snow and slush while keeping the kind of ride, low noise and handling you’d expect with a set of premium touring tires. Our recommendations in 245/65R17 touring tires include the Michelin X-Ice Snow, Bridgestone Blizzak DM-V2, Nokian Hakkapeliitta 9 SUV, or [Yokohama iceGUARD G075](https://simpletire.com/brands/yokohama-tires/icceguard-g075). There’s just one caveat with winter tires; they use a tread formulation that’s designed to stay flexible in subfreezing weather, but will wear quickly in warmer temps. Make sure you switch out your winter tires when the thermometer climbs above about 40 degrees F and stays there. Whether you drive a Chevrolet Trailblazer, Ford Explorer, Toyota Highlander, or something else, SimpleTire has a set of 245/65R17 tires that meets your needs at a great price!

info.title: Did you know?
info.body: A reliable brand is the #1 ask for most drivers. Here you can shop all the most popular brands and discover new ones – all tested, ranked and rated by our customers.
